attributes.title: Physical Stock Take
attributes.description:
The stock exercise was conducted on 16 February 2025 to establish whether the internal controls were effective within the branch and to check if all the finished products and raw materials were matching with the system balances.

The physical inventory count appears to be accurate, with only minor discrepancies observed between the counted quantities and the recorded figures. These discrepancies are within an acceptable tolerance range and are likely due to normal operational fluctuations

The following findings were noted.

v  Poly bags had a cumulative variation of -307 pieces. It was also noted that two varieties had a significant variation 800 CTW had a variance of -1,397 pieces and 600 super nutria had negative variance of -110 piece. Branch don’t produced 600 super nutri

v  Bread stock had a short fall of -83.5 loaves.

Details of the findings were as illustrated  in the table below
attributes.recommendation: The branch management should maintain control of company assets by ensuring there’s follow up on daily stock takes. The manager should ensure stock out of material usage is done accurately so as to eliminate the variances noted
attributes.effect: Weak control was noted on bread stock and poly bags stock as depicted by significant variations.

value:
We will tighten stock controls in place to reduce the variation noted

Poly bags variations could be contributed by poor recording of the mixing chart and we will make follow up and ensure that mixing chart were recorded as per the actual production in order  to avoid interchange.
Stock variations were minimal but we shall work on it especially on bread stock and poly bags stock.

In the previous audit dated 18.11.2024. It was noted that the physical stock counted matched with the systems balance on almost all the stock items except poly bags which had a variation of -242 pieces, yeast had variance of 5 sachets and bread stock which had variation of -85.75 loaves
Previous

attributes.title: Bread Weight
attributes.description: The bread that was ready for dispatch to the market on 16 February 2025 was sampled and weighed to check whether it had correct weight standards as per the Weight and measures act. The underweight is shown in the table below.
attributes.recommendation: A follow up should be done by the branch management to ensure set dividing and packing standards are adhered to so as to eliminate cases of underweight
attributes.effect: Underweights should be discourage because it could expose the company to heavy penalties if caught by the weight and measures officials and also could lead to reputational risk hence loss customer’s as well as deny them value for their money.

value: Underweight were caused by overcooling. We will put more effort to ensure bread sent to market are of the correct weight,
Underweight were caused by overcooling due to slow speed of the slicers and also some time is lost due to coding of poly bags, however slicers are catching up.

In the previous audit, most of the sample varieties had high cases of underweight

The underweight bread were spread as follows; 400g W- 29%, 600g W- 31% and 800g W- 31%.
Previous

attributes.title: Bread Damages
attributes.description:
The branch damages were reviewed for a period of 44 days from 01.01.2025 to 13 February 2025. The damages were analyzed to establish whether they were within the limit of 0.50% and 0.2% for market and production damages respectively.

From the analysis, it was noted that the overall production damages were 0.34% of bread produced while market damages were 0.54% of sales for the same period.

Below is the summary of the analysis.

Table 1 Analysis of the production Damages

            Table 2 Analysis of the Market Damages
attributes.recommendation: Enhance controls within the production process to ensure bread produced is of good quality thereby minimize possibility of excess production and market damages
attributes.effect:
Excess damages surpassing the set threshold is a loss to the company.

High market bread damages can lead to customer dissatisfaction and lost sales.

High market bread damages are a significant financial liability. The cost of damaged bread that is not sold to customers must be deducted from revenue, which can reduce profits and cash flow.

value: We will try our best to control   bread damages to the acceptable levels.

Production damages were caused by negligence of the workers

Market damages are caused by poor handing of bread by customers especially mini shops. We have 6 mini shop. We realized the mini shop order is more than their sales. We will control mini shop orders to reduce the returns.
In the previous audit from the analysis, it was noted that the overall production damages were 0.30% of bread produced while market damages were 0.48% of sales for the same period
Previous

attributes.title: Damages Sent to ingredients Department
attributes.description:
Analysis was conducted on damages sent to ingredients department to establish whether damages sent matched with damages recorded on the SAP systems/ cash flow.

For the period of 44 days from 1 January 25 to 13 February 2025. We noted a significant difference between total damages at the branch level and damages sent to ingredients damages. Total branch damages were 8,893.25 pieces while those sent to ingredients plus damages in the branch on 14 February 2025 were 8,728.25pieces, resulting in a variance of -165  pieces of bread.

It was noted that damages were stored in an open store which was not locked. Therefore it was very easy to destroyer damages without the knowledge of the branch manager.

The table below illustrates the summary of the findings

Table 3 Analysis of the Damages sent to ingredients department
attributes.recommendation:
Excess damages sent should be recovered.

Branch should enhance transparency and avoid overstating of the damages.

Is the responsibility of the assistant operation manager to check, verify and weigh damages before there are destroyed this improves accountability.
attributes.effect: Variance of damages sent to ingredients and damages recorded on SAP systems is significant and this implies weakness in control where damages were being overstated. The revenue loss was Ksh.8,745

value:
Variation on damages could have caused by moisture loss.

We will make follow up and try to ensure proper records are be maintain.
I will advise the manager and supervisors to ensure damages are correctly recorded.
During the prior audit it was noted that damages sent to ingredients were more by 20.75 kg.
Previous

attributes.title: Mixing Chart Analysis
attributes.description:
The mixing chart, mixing chart summaries, and cash flow were reviewed from 01.01.2025 to 13.02.2025 to check the average bags, the average yield, the utto consumption, the extent of the remixes, the figures transferred from mixing chart to cash flow if they are accurate and also to verify and confirm if the total finished product posted on the SAP was matching the mixing chart recorded at the production area. The following findings were noted.

v  Average production was 119.45 bags per day representing 79.64% of target which is 150bags per day (Branch Capacity)

v  Average yield was 192.31

v  Utto consumption was 100%.

v  No remix were noted over the audit period.

The table below illustrates the summary of the findings.
attributes.recommendation: The branch should strive to ensure that they attain their target.
attributes.effect: Failure to achieve production implies the company never achieved the expected revenues.

value: The production target is affected by low sales that prompt use to cut productionThe production target is affected by low sales that prompt use to cut production.
The production target is affected by low sales that prompt use to cut production.The production target is affected by low sales that prompt use to cut production..

attributes.title: Cash count
attributes.description:
An analysis was done in the cash office to verify whether the cashier had the sum amount that was expected to be in his possession

The cashier was expected to have Ksh.178, 765.00, but cash counted was Ksh.178,765. A variance of +1shillings.
attributes.recommendation: The The branch management is encouraged to keep up with the cash control measures.
attributes.effect: Cash controls were strong and working effectively.

value: Cash Controls are okay we will keep up
Cash Controls are okay we will keep up
It was noted that the cashier accounted for all the cash balance
Previous

attributes.title: Production Efficiency
attributes.description:
The production efficiency was calculated for a sample period of a 44 days from 1 January to 13 February 2025. The aim was to establish if the branch was achieving the set production efficiency of 4.50 bags per production worker.

From the analysis it was noted that production efficiency was 4.17 bags per production worker.

Details of the finding were as illustrated on the table below.
attributes.recommendation: The branch should enhance controls to efficiently utilize the labour
attributes.effect: The branch did not achieve the set production efficiency target meaning that the cost of production was above set budget

value:
Production efficiency was contributed by shift cuts due to low sales.

Also machine break down have contributed to low efficiency

Production Efficiency affected by shift cuts due to high bread balance.

We will do orientation to production team so that their can understand their responsibility
In prior audit production efficiency was found at 4.1 bags per production worker
Previous

attributes.title: Packing Efficiency
attributes.description:
Production Efficiency affected by shift cuts due to high bread balance.

We will do orientation to production team so that their can understand their responsibility

Packing efficiency calculated with an intention of establishing whether the branch was achieving the set target of the 97 crates per slicers.

For 44 days from 1 January 2025 to 13 February 2025, it was found that the packing efficiency was 89.23 crates per slicer.
attributes.recommendation: Hiring of Packers shift wise should be guided by the number of bags produced in the prior shift. This will enable the branch to achieve set target
attributes.effect: Average packing efficiency was below the set target implying an extra cost of Ksh.54,720.00 incurred by paying 60 extra slicers.

value: Packing efficiency was affected by slow speed of slicers. We will try our best to improve the efficiency
Packing efficiency is low and we are working on continuous improvement to ensure this improves
In prior audit packing efficiency was found at 87.70% per slicer.
Previous

attributes.title: Vehicle Fuel consumption
attributes.description:
The purpose of this audit was to assess and analyze the fuel consumption within the branch sales vehicle for the period 01.02.2025 – 14.02.2025. The primary objectives were to evaluate compliance with fuel efficiency standards, identify any areas of inefficiency, and recommend strategies for reducing fuel consumption and associated costs. The audit encompassed a comprehensive review of fuel records, maintenance logs, and related policies and procedures.

From the analysis it was noted that fuel consumption of all vehicles were within the set standard.
attributes.recommendation: Maintain and enhance the fuel management controls within the branch
attributes.effect: All route vehicles’ fuel consumption was well controlled

value: We will maintain
We will maintain

attributes.title: Generator Fuel Consumption
attributes.description:
The generator fuel consumption rate was reviewed from 1 January – 16 February 2025 to establish and to confirm if the consumption rate was within the set standards. For the period reviewed, the consumption rate according to the records was 35.79 litres/hour.

The table below illustrates the findings:
attributes.recommendation: Branch to maintain the trend
attributes.effect: The generator fuel consumption was well controlled.

value: We fill in fuel with instructions from our seniors and records kept for accountability.
Generator fuel is well maintained, before additional of fuel branch has to confirm fuel to be added. We will check and make sure records are tallying both system and book
